briefdescription.para: nanoseconds in a second
microseconds in a second
milliseconds in a second

microseconds in a millisecond

briefdescription.para: AllocateAndGetTcpExTableFromStack() is undocumented and not exported, but is the only way to do this in older XP versions.

simplesect.para: true if the procedures could be loaded

briefdescription.para: get pid from localhost tcp connection using peer_port This function is available on WinXP >= SP3

simplesect.para: process id or 0 if connection has not been found

briefdescription.para: get pid from localhost tcp connection using peer_port This function is available on all WinXP versions, but not in wine (at least version <= 1.6.0)

simplesect.para: process id or 0 if connection has not been found

briefdescription.para: return peer process id from tcp handle for localhost connections

simplesect.para: process id or 0 in case the process id could not be fetched

briefdescription.para: Socket interface.

detaileddescription.para: Like _dbus_read(), but only works on sockets so is available on Windows.

Thin wrapper around the read() system call that appends the data it reads to the DBusString buffer. It appends up to the given count, and returns the same value and same errno as read(). The only exception is that _dbus_read_socket() handles EINTR for you. _dbus_read_socket() can return ENOMEM, even though regular UNIX read doesn't.

parameterdescription.para: the file descriptor to read from
the buffer to append data to
the amount of data to read

simplesect.para: the number of bytes read or -1

memberdef.argsstring: (int fd, const DBusString *buffer, int start, int len)
memberdef.name: _dbus_write_socket

briefdescription.para: Thin wrapper around the write() system call that writes a part of a DBusString and handles EINTR for you.

detaileddescription.para: Like _dbus_write(), but only supports sockets and is thus available on Windows.

parameterdescription.para: the buffer to write data from
the first byte in the buffer to write
the number of bytes to try to write

simplesect.para: the number of bytes written or -1 on error

briefdescription.para: Closes a file descriptor.

detaileddescription.para: Socket interface.

simplesect.para: FALSE if error set

briefdescription.para: Sets the file descriptor to be close on exec.

detaileddescription.para: Should be called for all file descriptors in D-Bus code.

parameterdescription.para: the Windows HANDLE (a SOCKET is also OK)

briefdescription.para: Sets a file descriptor to be nonblocking.

simplesect.para: TRUE on success.

memberdef.argsstring: (int fd, const DBusString *buffer1, int start1, int len1, const DBusString *buffer2, int start2, int len2)
memberdef.name: _dbus_write_socket_two

briefdescription.para: Like _dbus_write() but will use writev() if possible to write both buffers in sequence.

detaileddescription.para: Like _dbus_write_two() but only works on sockets and is thus available on Windows.

The return value is the number of bytes written in the first buffer, plus the number written in the second. If the first buffer is written successfully and an error occurs writing the second, the number of bytes in the first is returned (i.e. the error is ignored), on systems that don't have writev. Handles EINTR for you. The second buffer may be NULL.

parameterdescription.para: first byte to write in first buffer
number of bytes to write from first buffer
first byte to write in second buffer
number of bytes to write in second buffer

simplesect.para: total bytes written from both buffers, or -1 on error
FALSE if no memory

briefdescription.para: Measure the message length without terminating nul.

detaileddescription.para: Measure the length of the given format string and arguments, not including the terminating nul.

briefdescription.para: Returns the UTF-16 form of a UTF-8 string.

detaileddescription.para: The result should be freed with dbus_free() when no longer needed.

briefdescription.para: Returns the UTF-8 form of a UTF-16 string.

detaileddescription.para: The result should be freed with dbus_free() when no longer needed.

briefdescription.para: The only reason this is separate from _dbus_getpid() is to allow it on Windows for logging but not for other purposes.

simplesect.para: process ID to put in log messages

briefdescription.para: Gets our SID.

parameterdescription.para: points to sid buffer, need to be freed with LocalFree()
the process id for which the sid should be returned

simplesect.para: process sid

briefdescription.para: Creates a full-duplex pipe (as in socketpair()).

detaileddescription.para: Sets both ends of the pipe nonblocking.

parameterdescription.para: return location for the other end
TRUE if pipe should be blocking

simplesect.para: FALSE on failure (if error is set)

briefdescription.para: Wrapper for poll().

parameterdescription.para: number of descriptors in the array

simplesect.para: numbers of fds with revents, or <0 on error

briefdescription.para: Exit the process, returning the given value.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *host, const char *port, const char *family, DBusError *error)
memberdef.name: _dbus_connect_tcp_socket

briefdescription.para: Creates a socket and connects to a socket at the given host and port.

detaileddescription.para: The connection fd is returned, and is set up as nonblocking.

parameterdescription.para: the host name to connect to
the address family to listen on, NULL for all

simplesect.para: connection file descriptor or -1 on error

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *host, const char *port, const char *family, const char *noncefile, DBusError *error)
memberdef.name: _dbus_connect_tcp_socket_with_nonce

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *host, const char *port, const char *family, DBusString *retport, int **fds_p, DBusError *error)
memberdef.name: _dbus_listen_tcp_socket

briefdescription.para: Creates a socket and binds it to the given path, then listens on the socket.

detaileddescription.para: The socket is set to be nonblocking. In case of port=0 a random free port is used and returned in the port parameter. If inaddr_any is specified, the hostname is ignored.

parameterdescription.para: the host name to listen on
the port to listen on, if zero a free port will be used
the address family to listen on, NULL for all
string to return the actual port listened on
location to store returned file descriptors

simplesect.para: the number of listening file descriptors or -1 on error

briefdescription.para: Accepts a connection on a listening socket.

detaileddescription.para: Handles EINTR for you.

simplesect.para: the connection fd of the client, or -1 on error

briefdescription.para: Sends a single nul byte with our UNIX credentials as ancillary data.

detaileddescription.para: Returns TRUE if the data was successfully written. On systems that don't support sending credentials, just writes a byte, doesn't send any credentials. On some systems, such as Linux, reading/writing the byte isn't actually required, but we do it anyway just to avoid multiple codepaths.
Fails if no byte can be written, so you must select() first.
The point of the byte is that on some systems we have to use sendmsg()/recvmsg() to transmit credentials.

parameterdescription.para: file descriptor for connection to server

simplesect.para: TRUE if the byte was sent

briefdescription.para: Reads a single byte which must be nul (an error occurs otherwise), and reads unix credentials if available.

detaileddescription.para: Fills in pid/uid/gid with -1 if no credentials are available. Return value indicates whether a byte was read, not whether we got valid credentials. On some systems, such as Linux, reading/writing the byte isn't actually required, but we do it anyway just to avoid multiple codepaths.
Fails if no byte is available, so you must select() first.
The point of the byte is that on some systems we have to use sendmsg()/recvmsg() to transmit credentials.

parameterdescription.para: struct to fill with credentials of client

simplesect.para: TRUE on success

briefdescription.para: Checks to make sure the given directory is private to the user.

simplesect.para: FALSE on failure

briefdescription.para: Appends the given filename to the given directory.

xrefdescription.para: it might be cute to collapse multiple '/' such as "foo//" concat "//bar"

simplesect.para: TRUE on success

briefdescription.para: Adds the credentials corresponding to the given username.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the username existed and we got some credentials

briefdescription.para: Adds the credentials of the current process to the passed-in credentials object.

simplesect.para: FALSE if no memory; does not properly roll back on failure, so only some credentials may have been added

briefdescription.para: Append to the string the identity we would like to have when we authenticate, on UNIX this is the current process UID and on Windows something else, probably a Windows SID string.

detaileddescription.para: No escaping is required, that is done in dbus-auth.c. The username here need not be anything human-readable, it can be the machine-readable form i.e. a user id.

simplesect.para: FALSE on no memory

briefdescription.para: Gets our process ID.

simplesect.para: process ID

briefdescription.para: Sleeps the given number of milliseconds.
Get current time, as in gettimeofday().

detaileddescription.para: Never uses the monotonic clock.

parameterdescription.para: return location for number of seconds
return location for number of microseconds

briefdescription.para: Get current time, as in gettimeofday().

detaileddescription.para: Use the monotonic clock if available, to avoid problems when the system time changes.

parameterdescription.para: return location for number of seconds
return location for number of microseconds

briefdescription.para: signal (SIGPIPE, SIG_IGN);
Creates a directory; succeeds if the directory is created or already existed.

detaileddescription.para: directory interface

simplesect.para: TRUE on success

briefdescription.para: Generates the given number of random bytes, using the best mechanism we can come up with.

parameterdescription.para: the number of random bytes to append to string

simplesect.para: TRUE on success, FALSE if no memory

briefdescription.para: Gets the temporary files directory by inspecting the environment variables TMPDIR, TMP, and TEMP in that order.

detaileddescription.para: If none of those are set "/tmp" is returned

simplesect.para: location of temp directory, or NULL if no memory for locking

briefdescription.para: Deletes the given file.

simplesect.para: TRUE if unlink() succeeded

briefdescription.para: On GNU libc systems, print a crude backtrace to stderr.

detaileddescription.para: On other systems, print "no backtrace support" and block for possible gdb attachment if an appropriate environment variable is set.

briefdescription.para: Reads the uuid of the machine we're running on from the dbus configuration.

detaileddescription.para: Optionally try to create it (only root can do this usually).

On UNIX, reads a file that gets created by dbus-uuidgen in a post-install script. On Windows, if there's a standard machine uuid we could just use that, but I can't find one with the right properties (the hardware profile guid can change without rebooting I believe). If there's no standard one we might want to use the registry instead of a file for this, and I'm not sure how we'd ensure the uuid gets created.

parameterdescription.para: guid to init with the machine's uuid
try to create the uuid if it doesn't exist

simplesect.para: FALSE if the error is set

briefdescription.para: Returns the address of a new session bus.

detaileddescription.para: If successful, returns TRUE and appends the address to address. If a failure happens, returns FALSE and sets an error in error.

parameterdescription.para: a DBusString where the address can be stored
a DBusError to store the error in case of failure

simplesect.para: TRUE on success, FALSE if an error happened

briefdescription.para: Makes the file readable by every user in the system.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the file's permissions could be changed.

briefdescription.para: Atomically increments an integer.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the integer to increment

simplesect.para: the value before incrementing

briefdescription.para: Atomically decrement an integer.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the integer to decrement

simplesect.para: the value before decrementing

briefdescription.para: Atomically get the value of an integer.

detaileddescription.para: It may change at any time thereafter, so this is mostly only useful for assertions.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the integer to get

simplesect.para: the value at this moment

briefdescription.para: Called when the bus daemon is signaled to reload its configuration; any caches should be nuked.

detaileddescription.para: Of course any caches that need explicit reload are probably broken, but c'est la vie.

briefdescription.para: See if errno is EAGAIN or EWOULDBLOCK (this has to be done differently for Winsock so is abstracted)

simplesect.para: TRUE if e == EAGAIN or e == EWOULDBLOCK

briefdescription.para: return the absolute path of the dbus installation

simplesect.para: FALSE on failure

briefdescription.para: find config file either from installation or build root according to the following path layout install-root/ bin/dbus-daemon[d].exe etc/<config-file>.conf or etc/dbus-1/<config-file>.conf (the former above is what dbus4win uses, the latter above is what a "normal" Unix-style "make install" uses)

detaileddescription.para: build-root/ bin/dbus-daemon[d].exe bus/<config-file>.conf

briefdescription.para: Determines the address of the session bus by querying a platform-specific method.

detaileddescription.para: The first parameter will be a boolean specifying whether or not a dynamic session lookup is supported on this platform.
If supported is TRUE and the return value is TRUE, the address will be appended to address. If a failure happens, returns FALSE and sets an error in error.
If supported is FALSE, ignore the return value.

parameterdescription.para: returns whether this method is supported
a DBusString where the address can be stored
a DBusError to store the error in case of failure

simplesect.para: TRUE on success, FALSE if an error happened

briefdescription.para: Appends the directory in which a keyring for the given credentials should be stored.

detaileddescription.para: The credentials should have either a Windows or UNIX user in them. The directory should be an absolute path.
On UNIX the directory is ~/.dbus-keyrings while on Windows it should probably be something else, since the dotfile convention is not normal on Windows.

parameterdescription.para: credentials the directory should be for

simplesect.para: FALSE on no memory

briefdescription.para: Checks if a file exists.

detaileddescription.para: File interface.

simplesect.para: TRUE if file exists

briefdescription.para: A wrapper around strerror() because some platforms may be lame and not have strerror().

simplesect.para: error description.

briefdescription.para: Assigns an error name and message corresponding to a Win32 error code to a DBusError.

detaileddescription.para: Does nothing if error is NULL.

briefdescription.para: Removes a directory; Directory must be empty.

simplesect.para: TRUE on success

briefdescription.para: Checks whether the filename is an absolute path.

simplesect.para: TRUE if an absolute path

briefdescription.para: NOTE: If you modify this function, please also consider making the corresponding change in GLib.

detaileddescription.para: See glib/gutils.c:g_check_setuid().
Returns TRUE if the current process was executed as setuid (or an equivalent __libc_enable_secure is available). See: http://osdir.com/ml/linux.lfs.hardened/2007-04/msg00032.html
